item.title: Today’s Wordle #1596: Hints And Answer For November 1, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1596 on November 1, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 1, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1596 keeps the difficulty about the same as yesterday’s. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.2 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it’s slightly higher than the 4.3-guess average on October 31.

General Wordle Hints For November 1

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two vowels.
  • Hint 2: It includes at least one letter from the word “hotel.”
  • Hint 3: It’s a place associated with travel.
  • Hint 4: Similar to a hotel, but often found along highways.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1596 for November 1, 2025

Starter Words For November 1, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • HOTEL
  • MELON
  • METAL

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1596 On November 1, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: MOTEL

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1595 on October 31, 2025:

Answer: ABHOR

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1596?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 2 will be Wordle Game #1597.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake Coming To Xbox
item.content:encoded:
Bloober Team’s epic Silent Hill 2 remake smashed it out of the park on PS5 and PC. The title was a console exclusive for the PS5, but a new ESRB rating has revealed that the Silent Hill 2 remake is coming to Xbox Series X|S consoles.

It seems the Silent Hill 2 remake was potentially on a timed exclusivity agreement. This is the feeling as the horror remake has been rated by the ESRB for the “Xbox Series.” There’s still no Nintendo Switch port in the open, but the game’s console presence is about to become wider and more terrifying.

ESRB Rates Silent Hill 2 For Xbox Series X|S

Poor James Sunderland, he has to relive his own personal trauma all over again on Xbox. On the plus side, it’s a nice Halloween treat for Xbox players who’ve upgraded to modern-gen hardware.

The ESRB website was updated on October 31 (of all dates) to show Silent Hill 2 being certified. The key difference this time is that it’s for “Xbox Series” platforms, and the news comes nearly a year after the PS5 and PC launches.

From what we can tell, nothing’s changed on the rating summary front. It’s still the same Mature 17+ rating, and features the same depraved content, the same gruesome and gory gameplay, and the same “Enemies with body parts sewn together.”

It doesn’t clarify when Silent Hill 2’s remake is coming to Xbox. We’ll have to wait for an official announcement in the future—maybe closer to The Game Awards?

For now, if you’re on Xbox and you haven’t played the second game’s exquisite remake, we advise you to get the sick bags on standby and have a nice supply of light bulbs at the ready, as playing this in the dark will mentally put you in Silent Hill while you’re trying to sleep!

item.title: How Much Does Sword of Justice Cost? Free To Play Status & Price Explained
item.content:encoded:
After achieving huge success in China, Sword of Justice is gearing up for a major global release, and we’ve got all the details on the title’s free-to-play status.

Sword of Justice is releasing on November 7 and is exclusively available on PC and mobile devices, with no launch on console platforms like PlayStation 5 or Xbox Series X|S, but there is a huge platform to build upon after achieving over four million players in the first month of release in China.

If you’re considering Sword of Justice but want to know whether you have to splash out on the title, or if it’s available for free, we’ve got everything you need to know.

Is Sword of Justice Free to Play?

Yes, Sword of Justice is completely free to play, with monetization coming in the form of optional cosmetics for your character.

The free-to-play business model has proven to be a big success if managed correctly, and Sword of Justice looks to have set itself perfectly after achieving vast success in its initial release in China—attracting over four million players in the first month of operating.

Similar success is expected across the rest of the world with the global launch on November 7, putting players in the forefront of a new adventure that offers over 100 hours of single-player content and optional PvP environments.

How to Play Sword of Justice For Free

Playing Sword of Justice for free has two major steps: downloading the game and creating an account to access the game.

Sword of Justice is an MMORPG, with constant internet connection required and a dedicated account with the game in order to play, meaning you can’t just download the game and dive in without registering. However, this does open the door to consistent benefits being provided as in-game rewards.

Here’s a step-by-step guide to get started in Sword of Justice without spending a dollar.

  1. Open Steam on your PC, or the App Store on your mobile device.
  2. Search for ‘Sword of Justice’.
  3. Download the title.
  4. Open the game.
  5. Create an account.
  6. Sign in to the game.
  7. Enjoy playing!
